title: Man Utd injury news: Anthony Martial winning race to be fit for Liverpool clash
text:
Anthony Martial hopes to be fit to face Liverpool (Picture: Getty)

Manchester United forward Anthony Martial is hopeful of recovering in time to face Liverpool on Sunday after resuming light training.

The Frenchman has been out of action since United’s defeat to Crystal Palace in August with a thigh strain.

United initially expected Martial to miss between two to three weeks of action but his recovery has been slow and the Red Devils have paid the price in his absence, scoring just three times in five league matches.

However, sources have told Metro.co.uk that Martial came through a training session unscathed on Tuesday and is on course to feature on Sunday.

Martial has been out for seven weeks with a thigh injury (Picture: Getty)

The 23-year-old has been doing extra sessions over the international break in a desperate bid to return and his availability would be a huge boost for Ole Gunnar Solskjaer.

But Martial’s return would by no means be the end of Solskjaer’s injury problems.

Like Martial, Luke Shaw has been absent since the defeat to Palace and the club expected the left-back to be fit for Sunday.

However, Shaw has not made the necessary progress following his hamstring strain and is now likely to miss out against Jurgen Klopp’s side.

Aaron Wan-Bissaka is in contention after recovering from illness, while Victor Lindelof has recovered from the back injury that prevented him from playing in the 1-0 defeat to Newcastle ten days ago.

Liverpool are bidding to match Manchester City’s Premier League record of winning 18 matches on the bounce with a victory at the Theatre of Dreams.

The Reds have an eight-point lead at the top of the table and Pep Guardiola will be hoping for a favour from Manchester City’s arch rivals.
